description: Riley v. California - warrantless search of cell phone during arrest
facts: Riley was arrested for weapons violations
Officer searched Riley's cell phone without warrant
Phone contained digital photos and videos
Search revealed evidence of gang affiliation
Search occurred incident to lawful arrest
asp_facts: case(riley). amendment(riley, fourth). police_action(riley, cell_phone_search). lawful_arrest(riley, yes). warrant_obtained(riley, no). search_incident_to_arrest(riley, claimed). digital_data_accessed(riley, yes). vast_quantity_of_data(riley, yes). sensitive_information(riley, yes).
question: Can police search digital contents of a cell phone seized during an arrest without a warrant?
rationale: Modern cell phones are not just another technological convenience but hold vast quantities of sensitive personal information. The search-incident-to-arrest exception does not apply to digital data on cell phones. Officers must generally secure a warrant before searching a cell phone.
